title.narrative: Private Seed Sector Development

description.narrative: The Private Seed Sector Development (PSSD) project aims to double production and income of 108.000 farmer households in Burundi by ensuring sustainable access to certified seeds and agricultural advisory services. The project is a private sector development (PSD) project that will incentivize and support Burundian and international seed companies to pilot innovations related to seed production and sales.

The project will focus on the development of sales strategies that are tailored to farmer household requirements. This includes: 1. The sale of seeds in micro-packs 2. Development of last-mile distribution capabilities a. Rural points of sales (POS) b. Mobile sales agents 3. Micro-demonstration plots 4. Consumer education-focused communication strategies tailored to farmers 5. Development of specialized promotional materials tailored to farmers The project will moreover support seed companies to increase production efficiencies though the provision of technical and targeted financial support for: 1. Critical infrastructure upgrades 2. Intensification of production PSSD will furthermore support initiatives to improve the business-enabling environment in relation to seed production and sales in Burundi. The project will among others target: 1. Liberalization of seed prices 2. Improvement of seed inspection and certification services 3. Policy coherency in relation to variety release and registration

activity-date.narrative: The proposed PSSD project builds on the experiences and achievements of integrated seed sector development (ISSD) project in Burundi, implemented by IFDC, KIT and partners since 2014. PSSD seeks to rapidly grow the market with quality seeds of beans, maize and potatoes with private sector partners and ensure solid collaborative partnerships with public sectors in establishing a commercially viable seed systems.

Output 2.x.1 Number of family farms directly reached

This is an output indicator results directly measured thru' surveys among households, beneficiaries received training, seeds and partnership related activities that are reflected by the following key measures; Number of HH that received training on a demonstration plot from project partners [#] Number of HH that purchase certified seed from project partners [#] Cumulative number of demonstration plots installed [#]
Output 5.3 Number of businesses co-investing in FNS activities

This output indicator is measured through several co-factors such as Number of businesses (project partners) co-investing in FNS activities (local, international and Ducth), volume of investments by the business operations, and # of contracts signed thru' the new businesses besides volume of seed transactions thru' different stakeholder channels. Other factors that influence this output indicator also include change in production cost and amount good quality, formally produced i.e, certified seeds and better functioning of varietal registration system.
Output 5.1 Number of jobs supported in agricultural chains/sectors

The results for this output measurement will be derived from surveys among partners (public, private, CSOs) due to PSSD related interventions and activities generated. Change in cumulative number of permanent employees [#] (mobile sales agents, agro-dealers, seed farm labor) Change in cumulative number of part-time / seasonal employees [#] (seed farm labor)
Output 4.3 Number of FNS-relevant knowledge institutions that perform better

Number of FNS-relevant knowledge institutions that perform better; this is calculated by the performance of partner institutions in the project viz., public, private and CSOs. The performance will be measured thru' the increase in the number of registered members (farmers, private traders etc) and the dissemination/advocacy activities launched for them to provide better knowledge. The performance or operational efficiency also will be reflected in the volume of seeds used or accessed at various stake holders level including access to better varieties, their EGS and volume of foundation seeds produced and certified etc., The primary institutions from whom these and other related information on seed volumes will be collected include COPROSEBU, ISABU. DPSP, ONCCS.
Output 7.1. Number of improvements in major (inter)national FNS policies/laws

Number of improvements in major (inter)national FNS policies/laws that benefit at least hundreds of thousands of households in Burundi. This includes policies by ONCSS on seed certification through accredited inspectors; payment of accredited seed inspectors, seed certification costs and payments, introduction of seed packaging. Other policies include regulating the seed operations thru' agencies (DPSP) by introduction of policies on EGS by private sector, on the production of multiple generations of seed by private sector; liberalization of seed prices; introduction of policy on variety release and registration process and costs etc.
Outcome 2.2 Number of family farms with improved access to input

This is an outcome indicator measured cumulatively through the following indicator results; Cumulative HH that purchase certified seed [#] from partners and non-partners Cumulative number of HH that received training on a demonstration plot [#] from partners and non-partners Volume of certified seed sold in Burundi [MT]
Outcome 2.1 (Cumulative) Number of family farms with increased productivity (and/or income)

The outcome 2.1 indicator contributes directly to the Impact level results; this indicator will be measured through collecting information through household surveys, training conducted, purchases of seeds by farmers and other partners and partnerships related information on the following lines during the implementation period. Total production change per HH [kg] Gross revenue change of HH [control for price inflation] [$] Yield change of HH [kg/ha] Total volume of harvest sold per HH [kg)
Impact 2 Number of family farms that doubled productivity and/or income

The impact level indicator contributing to FNS and will be measured towards the end of the project through household surveys collecting information on the following set of measures since the project started implementation; Total production change per HH of bottom 20% of HH [kg] Gross revenue change of bottom 20% of HH [control for price inflation] [$] Yield change of bottom 20% of HH [kg/ha] Total volume of harvest sold per HH by bottom 20% of HH [kg]
Output 4.1 Number of farmers that adopted research results/knowledge/new technologies

This output indicator is measured thru' determining the following set of results from the activities conducted; the targets are annual and are achieved over 4 quarters, across the households, from their seed purchasing behavior, the sources of purchase and the knowledge gained from adopting new seed varieties with improved yields, and other attributable qualities. Number of farmers that use newly introduced seed varieties (from 2018 and later) "Number of family farms that use newly introduced Dutch seed varieties (from 2018 & later)" Rate of replacement of certified seed [frequency] Usage of fertilizer
